data.title: Crash with big json
data.body:
On https://realfavicongenerator.net (@realfavicongenerator) you can also get JSON files for their [API](https://realfavicongenerator.net/api/non_interactive_api#.Vpuc_FIxmUk). In them the image/favicon can added base64 encoded.

So when I save the RAW file (which only consists of one line) I can open it in Atom.
However when I use a format package for Atom or a web service which formats this JSON and I try to open the formatted version in Atom or paste the formatted text into a new file Atom crashes.
In the error message it says I should report this error here and it gives me the opportunity to reload Atom.

Here you can find the test files: https://gist.github.com/rugk/c23a5978e2f037b1ffaa

Atom 1.4.0
Windows 7

data.title: help needed
data.body:
Hello,
I have been using atom before too. I just bought a new laptop 2 days before and had windows 10 installed in it. After that i tried a lot of times to install atom but the system gives error.
Please help me as soon as possible because i have a lot of works pending on the way.

data.title: Control characters at the end of the line cause the cursor to disappear
data.body:
I discovered this after pasting lines that had been copied from a web page.[1]

(Notice that at the beginning of the video, the column number changes but the cursor doesn't move.  I'm pressing Right and Left to go forward and backward over the control character at the beginning of the line.  This may be #1839 - "Control characters are not shown".)

Then I press Right repeatedly to get to the end of the line.  The cursor vanishes.  I dance around with Right and Left a bit.  Then I press Right until I'm at the beginning of the next line.

![atom-control-characters-not-shown-and-cause-cursor-to-disappear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/380880/12376473/f745e0f2-bcaa-11e5-8d47-f4f89cff11ea.gif)

The character sequence after the 2 close parens at the end of the last line of text is `e2 80 8b`, then `\n`.

[1] - If you have access to O'Reilly Safari: the text I used to repro this is on https://www.safaribooksonline.com/library/view/programming-clojure-2nd/9781941222836/f_0042.html .  It's the code sample immediately below the text "Clojurish in another way as well:"

data.title: Docs for Point don't state whether rows and columns are indexed from 0 or 1
data.body:
The docs for Point don't state whether rows and columns are indexed from 0 or 1.

https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.4.0/Point

```
Point [essential]

Represents a point in a buffer in row/column coordinates.

Every public method that takes a point also accepts a point-compatible Array.
This means a 2-element array containing Numbers representing the row and
column.  So the following are equivalent:

  new Point(1, 2)
  [1, 2] # Point compatible Array 
```

data.title: Incorrect list of symbols in PHP
data.body:
In PHP, if a function name first character is lowercased and the parameter is a strongly typed initialized array:
![screen shot 2016-01-17 at 10 59 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/12375536/62d04934-bd0a-11e5-8be5-c0fafefcfaf4.png)

Then pressing the shortcut "Goto Symbol", the list of symbols shows the parameter name instead of the function name.
(As a side note, somehow it pick "name" in the comment as a symbol as well.) 
![screen shot 2016-01-17 at 11 00 00 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/12375537/62d39d96-bd0a-11e5-8c15-6dc8ad518a15.png)

data.title: When installing updates to non-core packages, UI never advances beyond 'installing' UI
data.body:
Atom 1.3.3 on OS X 10.10.5.

Repro:
1.  Go to Settings -> Updates when updates to non-core packages are available.
2.  Click "Update to <version>" button for one of the update(s).
3.  The Update button goes into what I'm assuming is the "downloading and installing" state: vertical pinstripes, scrolling horizontally.

Expected:

When installation is finished, something happens.

Actual:

The UI never changes.  The button continues to scroll.  But the update did finish installing, which can be verified by:
-  Navigating away from Settings -> Updates and then back to Settings -> Updates.  The update that was installed in the repro steps is no longer listed in the available updates.
-  Going to Settings -> Packages and checking the installed version of the package updated in the repro steps.  The most recent version number is listed.

data.title: Update.exe eating CPU like edible paper
data.body: Whenever I start up atom, the update.exe launches and its CPU usage goes through the roof (until I force close it, but then it just launches again by itself later on). The CPU usage never goes down and it just sits there hogging it all. This happens constantly on my Windows 7 64-bit computer, but happens significantly less often on my Windows 10 32-bit laptop.

data.title: Can't select last sub-block of block, when last sub-block is folded.
data.body:
Best explained by gif. I'm trying to select last block, in a block, and it won't let me - while folded, without continuing to select the next parts - which are not what I want to select.

![2016-01-16_23-11-06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3121967/12374554/93231390-bca7-11e5-86f9-76e2791c2ad9.gif)

data.title: Save All save also not modified files
data.body: When using the Save all command, all the opened files are touched when not modified. I'll be better to save only modified files to keep track of the last modification time.

i get this:

(current: {"node":"5.4.1","npm":"3.5.3"})

everytime i start the build script.

data.title: add TextEditor::onDidPasteText
data.body: Add TextEditor::onDidPasteText is order to subscribe to the paste event.

data.title: Atom build freezes on linux
data.body:
While installing modules during build it always freezes after a while, like this:

```
$ script/build
Node: v0.12.9
npm: v2.13.3
Installing build modules...
=> Took 7334ms.

Installing apm...
=> Took 1737ms.

Deleting old packages...
=> Took 861ms.

Installing modules ✓
Installing update-package-dependencies@0.10.0 ✓
Installing welcome@0.33.0 ✓
Installing whitespace@0.32.1 ✓
Installing wrap-guide@0.38.1 ✓
Installing language-c@0.51.1 ✓
Installing language-clojure@0.19.1
```

Is this related to the github api rate limits as I get when using other dependency managers that downloads from github?

Using Ubuntu 15.10 64-bit with gnome.

data.title: Wrong search-replace order when replacing double quotes with single quotes
data.body:
To reproduce, create a new file containing just 4 quotes:

```
""""
```

Then find-replace double with single quotes

```
command-f ; " ; tab ; ' ; <repeat enter>
```

As you hit enter they will change one-by-one, but in the wrong order. 1->2->4->3 in the case above. And 1->3->4->2 in a similar case:

```
command-f ; " ; enter ; tab ; ' ; <repeat enter>
```

This is actually a big pain when trying to enforce certain quotation related styleguides on large files, because I end up bouncing all over the place.

I think it is specifically related to empty strings. The following does not seem to have any problem:

```
"foo" "bar"
```

data.title: Unable to insert comment marker at start of line
data.body:
I'm working on the Fortran language grammar package and I would like it if I could make `cmd+/` insert a comment character in the first column of the selected line/lines. However, it seems the only option available 

``` cson
'.source.fortran.fixed':
  'editor':
    'commentStart': 'C '
```

Inserts the comment character before the first non-whitespace character. For example

``` fortran
       call something()
```

goes to

``` fortran
       C call something()
```

While this works fine for most grammars, this does not work for languages like fixed form Fortran where the comment character **must** be the first character of the line.

data.title: Editing file in one pane causes same file in other pane to scroll
data.body: I think ideally this shouldn't be the case? I frequently have the same file open in two panes to view different sections. Editing one and having the other move around defeats the purpose.

data.title: Unable to paste in "New Folder" input when saving file (OS X)
data.body:
Repro Steps:
- Attempt to save a new file or "save as" an existing file
- Click "New Folder" in bottom left of window
- Try to paste some text in the new folder input using Command-V keyboard shortcut

Expected result:
- Text is pasted as the name of the new folder

Actual result:
- highlighted text is not removed or un-highlighted
- text from clipboard is not pasted
- sadness

Additional Notes:
- You _are_ able to right-click and select paste, which works as expected.
- Actions in the Menubar's Edit menu are greyed out in this mode as well

data.title: Update nodegit
data.body: Most notably this turns on the newly added thread safety.

data.title: 'find whole word' fails to find some reasonable search strings
data.body:
with 'find whole word' on, search for 'loggedIn(user)' in buffer will NOT find it in: ' loggedIn(user);'

(regexp and other selective search options were off)

with 'find whole word' off, it will find it there, but also in ' addAgentThenLoggedIn(user);' of course

in general 'find whole word' seems to sometimes defeat searches for some strings that are not themselves single whole words - though it works as it should sometimes, for some of them

for example, searching for 'loggedIn(' with 'find whole word' on seems to work correctly: it finds the target in ' loggedIn(user);' but not in  ' addAgentThenLoggedIn(user);'

atom 1.4.0

data.title: Atom editor failing to handle python code blocks within restructuredtext (not a package issue)
data.body:
What originated as an issue raised in the atom restructuredtext package has ultimately led me here.  The syntax highlighting for the code block is not being properly terminated by the editor.  

If you were to open this rst from within Atom:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/YosaiProject/yosai/master/doc/authorization.rst

scopes at cursor at line 127 shows the following:
text.restructuredtext source.gfm.restructuredtext
meta.paragraph.restructuredtext
source.python
meta.function-call.python
meta.function-call.arguments.python
invalid.illegal.operator.python

see issue:  https://github.com/Lukasa/language-restructuredtext/issues/32
